alert.note: Alert for Brewster; Jeff Davis; Pecos; Reeves; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued March 14 at 3:40PM CDT until March 14 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Brewster County in southwestern Texas... South central Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Southeastern Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Terrell County in southwestern Texas... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 340 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 24 miles south of McCamey to 16 miles south of Fort Stockton to 10 miles southeast of Balmorhea State Park, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 231 and 296. Locations impacted include... Fort Stockton, Alpine, Alpine-Casparis Municipal Airport, Balmorhea State Park, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport, Sierra Madera, Toyahvale, Firestone Test Track and Bakersfield. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Brewster; Jeff Davis; Pecos; Reeves; Terrell
